title: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Elements, Blois and Amboise", June 11, 1888
medium: Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, upper right corner: 40; lower right corner: 35; clockwise from top left: Note - The roof crestings at Blois / have always some gold / decoration, ie, on the portion / Louis XII - By cresting I / mean the lead on top of / ridge, not finial (underlined for emphasis) - Very / pretty idea. Lifting the / roof - ; Blois / chateau; Dormer / Amboise / June 13th 1888; A corner house / Amboise June 13th 1888; Right Staircase Tower.
description: Vertical sheet illustrated three sketches of buildings and architectural elements.  At top left is the right staircase tower at the Château de Blois.  It is a Romanesque tower with blind arcade decoration at the uppermost level, topped by a mansard roof with chimney.  At top right is a dormer that far overhangs the window opening below and ends in a curve.  Underneath the dormer has wooden tracery similar to a flamboyant Gothic style.  At bottom right is the corner of a masonry and half-timbered and plastered house.  The half-timbering is only on the upper story, ending with a small tower in the corner.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketches of Architectural Elements, Blois and Amboise", June 11, 1888.Graphite on thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-208.
